subject: Philosophy
title: Epiphenomenalism
description: A quick, practical guide to Epiphenomenalism.

hook.text: What if your feelings are real but powerless? Like steam from a train that doesn't push the wheels.

buildup.text: Epiphenomenalism says consciousness is a byproduct of brain activity. It exists but causes nothing.

discovery.text: The brain makes decisions. Consciousness just watches â€” a passenger, not the driver.

twist.text: If feelings don't cause anything, why did evolution bother creating them? That's the fatal objection.

climax.text: Most philosophers reject it, but it reveals how strange the mind-body connection truly is.

punchline.text: What if your mind is just watching the show?

quiz.question: What does epiphenomenalism claim about consciousness?
options: It exists but has no causal power
